name: Road density
functionStatement: Runoff and infiltration sustain natural flow regime, carry appropriate sediment and nutrients from uplands, and reliably cue spawning/migration of aquatic life.
descriptionMarkdown: Road density is low enough to avoid significant runoff or sediment inputs, consistent with minimal watershed impact.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Sum total road length inside the watershed boundary and divide by watershed area (km roads per km2) using a roads layer.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Highways and frontage roads crisscross basin. Frequent crossings to channel.
Criteria: >2 km/km2

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Grid network near town center. Several culvert crossings.
Criteria: 1-2 km/km2

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Collector roads present. Some drainage ditches.
Criteria: ~0.5-1.0 km/km2

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Few local roads. Rare stream crossings.
Criteria: <0.5 km roads/km2
